Today, the House passed H.J.Res. 76, a resolution to reverse @BetsyDeVosED's harmful rule & protect students defrauded by predatory, for-profit colleges. I was proud to cosponsor this resolution, because students shouldn't have to pay back loans for useless or faulty degrees.

#HR1695 enables the critical work of Community Action Agencies by:
- Preserving tools that help people escape poverty 
- Expanding accountability & transparency at all levels
- Modernizing #CSBG to address today's problems, such as the opioid epidemic pic.twitter.com/5fTpIXnuFC

Democrats & Republicans agree: #HR1695 modernizes the #CSBG program & renews our nation’s commitment to reducing poverty through 1,000+ Community Action Agencies (CAAs) serving communities nationwide. The work & benefits of these CAAs are felt in all 435 Congressional districts.

Proud to continue to stand with my friend @CongressmanGT to pass our legislation that would reauthorize the poverty-fighting work of Community Action Agencies. #HR1695 now has 145 cosponsors, 99 Ds and 46 Rs, and is one of the most bipartisan bills in Congress. #CSBG

Thank you to Boundary Waters champions @RepRooney, @NRDems Chairman @RepRaulGrijalva, @RepDeanPhillips, @RepLowenthal, and @RepFredUpton for joining me in introducing this critical legislation. Let’s #SaveThisWilderness #BWCA pic.twitter.com/rbKk9WSpWo
We cannot take America’s treasured places for granted. Future generations deserve to experience the pristine beauty & wonder of the #BWCA. #SaveTheseLands pic.twitter.com/CNr9jdEtCS

Sulfide-ore copper mining would put our natural resources at risk, hurt the local economy, and undermine the U.S.’ commitment to an international treaty. We must #SaveTheseWaters. #BWCA pic.twitter.com/JdVxnxMI9E

#HR5598 will permanently protect hundreds of thousands of acres of pristine lands & waters within the #BWCA from harmful sulfide-ore copper mining. We have a responsibility to preserve this irreplaceable national treasure. pic.twitter.com/8hdcl2dKTw

#PFAS (“forever chemicals”) are a growing environmental problem that must be addressed. I’m committed to doing so through both the significant investments @AppropsDems made in the FY20 federal funding bills, as well as through policy actions like today’s vote on #HR535.
